Question / Statement: Concrete is a material that is highly elastic.
Explanation: Concrete is a brittle material; Steel is elastic.

Question / Statement: In Limit State Design, the partial safety factor for steel is 1.5.
Explanation: For steel it is 1.15. For concrete, it is 1.5.

Question / Statement: An "Over-reinforced" section is preferred in beam design.
Explanation: "Under-reinforced" is preferred because it gives warning (ductile failure) before collapse.

Question / Statement: The minimum diameter of a longitudinal bar in a column is 12mm.
Explanation: Using smaller bars in main column reinforcement is not permitted by code (IS 456).

Question / Statement: "Stirrups" in beams are provided to resist Bending Moment.
Explanation: Stirrups are provided to resist Shear Force.

Question / Statement: The tensile strength of concrete is approximately 10-15% of its compressive strength.
Explanation: Concrete is very weak in tension.

Question / Statement: A column with a slenderness ratio greater than 12 is called a "Long Column".
Explanation: It is prone to buckling failure.

Question / Statement: Deformed bars (Tor steel) provide better bond with concrete than plain bars.
Explanation: The ribs/lugs on the surface increase grip (bond).

Question / Statement: The neutral axis is the layer where stress is zero.
Explanation: Compression is on one side, Tension on the other; NA has zero stress.

Question / Statement: Dead Load is the weight of movable furniture and people.
Explanation: That is Live Load. Dead Load is the weight of the structure itself.

Question / Statement: "Void Ratio" (e) can be greater than 1.
Explanation: Volume of voids can be larger than volume of solids (e.g., loose clay).

Question / Statement: "Porosity" (n) can be greater than 100%.
Explanation: Porosity is Volume of Voids / Total Volume. It can never exceed 100% (or 1.0).

Question / Statement: Darcy’s Law assumes the flow of water through soil is Turbulent.
Explanation: It assumes the flow is Laminar.

Question / Statement: Gravel is more permeable than Clay.
Explanation: Water passes through gravel easily; Clay acts as a barrier.

Question / Statement: The "Plasticity Index" (PI) is Liquid Limit minus Plastic Limit.
Explanation: PI=LL−PL.

Question / Statement: "Compaction" expels water from the soil pores.
Explanation: Compaction expels Air. "Consolidation" expels Water.

Question / Statement: The ultimate bearing capacity is the load at which soil fails.
Explanation: It is the maximum pressure the soil can support.

Question / Statement: Black Cotton Soil is excellent for building foundations.
Explanation: It is dangerous due to high swelling and shrinkage characteristics.

Question / Statement: A "Pycnometer" is used to determine the Specific Gravity of soil.
Explanation: It is a standard lab test for specific gravity.

Question / Statement: Rankine’s theory is used to calculate earth pressure on retaining walls.
Explanation: It calculates Active and Passive earth pressure.

Question / Statement: "Duty" is measured in hectares per cumec.
Explanation: It represents the area irrigated by one unit of discharge.

Question / Statement: "Delta" denotes the time period of the crop.
Explanation: Delta (Δ) is the total depth of water applied. Time is "Base Period".

Question / Statement: Drip irrigation has higher water efficiency than Sprinkler irrigation.
Explanation: Drip minimizes evaporation and runoff by applying water to roots.

Question / Statement: A "Weir" is a structure used to store water.
Explanation: A Weir raises water level to divert it; a Dam stores water.

Question / Statement: "Perennial Irrigation" means supplying water throughout the year.
Explanation: As opposed to "Inundation" (seasonal flood) irrigation.

Question / Statement: An "Aqueduct" carries a canal below a drainage.
Explanation: In an Aqueduct, the canal passes over (above) the drainage.

Question / Statement: The "Base Period" is the time between first watering and last watering.
Explanation: It is slightly shorter than the Crop Period.

Question / Statement: Lining of canals is done to increase seepage losses.
Explanation: Lining is done to reduce seepage losses and increase velocity.

Question / Statement: "Waterlogging" makes the land more fertile.
Explanation: Waterlogging brings salts to the surface (salinity) and ruins fertility.

Question / Statement: A "Divide Wall" separates the weir from the under-sluices.
Explanation: It creates a pocket for silt control in front of the canal head regulator.

Question / Statement: The unit of measurement for Earthwork in excavation is Square Meter (m2).
Explanation: Earthwork is measured in Cubic Meters (m3).

Question / Statement: 1 Bag of Cement weighs 50 kg.
Explanation: This is the standard commercial weight.

Question / Statement: "Contingencies" are usually added at 3% to 5% of the estimated cost.
Explanation: To cover unforeseen expenses.

Question / Statement: Brick partition walls (half-brick thick) are measured in running meters.
Explanation: They are usually measured in Square Meters (m2).

Question / Statement: "Scrap Value" is the value of a dismantled material.
Explanation: The value of "junk" after the building is pulled down.

Question / Statement: A "Revised Estimate" is prepared when the original estimate is exceeded by 5%.
Explanation: It is required if costs deviate significantly.

Question / Statement: The density of mild steel is 7850 kg/m3.
Explanation: A standard value used in estimation.

Question / Statement: "Plinth Area" includes the area of the courtyard.
Explanation: Plinth area is the covered area; open courtyards are excluded.

Question / Statement: Painting works are measured in Cubic Meters.
Explanation: Painting is measured in Square Meters (m2) (Surface area).

Question / Statement: "Lead" refers to the horizontal distance materials are carried.
Explanation: "Lift" is the vertical distance.

Question / Statement: The "Critical Path" is the shortest path in a network diagram.
Explanation: The Critical Path is the Longest path in time (determines project duration).

Question / Statement: A "Bar Chart" is also known as a Gantt Chart.
Explanation: Named after Henry Gantt.

Question / Statement: "Earnest Money" is deposited by the contractor after winning the bid.
Explanation: It is deposited with the tender (bid) to show seriousness. "Security Deposit" is after winning.

Question / Statement: A "Muster Roll" is used for paying permanent monthly salaried staff.
Explanation: It is used for daily wage laborers.

Question / Statement: "Slack" is the time an event can be delayed without delaying the project.
Explanation: Similar to Float for activities.

Question / Statement: A "Tender" is an offer to do work at a certain price.
Explanation: It is a formal bid.

Question / Statement: "Arbitration" is a method of settling disputes in court.
Explanation: It is a method of settling disputes outside of court.

Question / Statement: CPM stands for Construction Project Method.
Explanation: CPM stands for Critical Path Method.

Question / Statement: The "Measurement Book" (MB) is a very important legal document.
Explanation: It is the basis for all payments to contractors.

Question / Statement: Organization is the arrangement of personnel to achieve a goal.
Explanation: Structuring the team for efficiency.
